title: GHome Smart 3 Way Dimmer Switch, 3 Way Smart Switch for Light Compatible with Alexa, Google Assistant, Neutral Wire Needed, 2.4GHz WiFi Light Switch, UL Certified, No Hub Required, 3 Pack

product_information.Best Sellers Rank: Best Sellers Rank:  #48,759 in Tools & Home Improvement (See Top 100 in Tools & Home Improvement)    #169 in Electrical Light Switches       #169 in Electrical Light Switches

product_category: Tools & Home Improvement›Electrical›Switches & Dimmers›Wall Switches›Light Switches
feature_bullets: 【3 Way Smart Dimmer Switch】This 3-way smart switch SW17 is designed to be used with a ordinary 3-way switch and cannot be used in pairs with smart switch. Single-Pole is also supported. NOTE: 4-way and multi-way are not supported. 2.4GHz Wi-Fi connection only (Don't support 5G WiFi)

【Easy Installation】For 3-way, this SW17 smart switch must be installed on the Line Side, neutral wire is required. For 1-way, please use one of the traveler terminal as the load wire to connect light. 【Attention】For a better user experience, please download the APP to pair the switch and follow the prompts to update the firmware to V1.1.9.

【1%-100% Dimming Control】Just slide your finger to adjust the brightness, or set the optimal dimming range in the app to create a perfect atmosphere. INPUT: 120V~ 60Hz; OUTPUT: 120V~ 60Hz, 4A Max. Supports dimmable bulbs up to 450W. NOTE: Not compatible with smart bulbs.

【Brightness Range】New brightness range bar only to address the issue of a few bulbs flickering at low brightness, just increase the minimum value when it's flashing. Otherwise, please default the Range Value to 1% -100% for normal use.Because for non flashing light bulbs, limiting the range value will also lock the switch dimming range.

【Smart Voice Control】This 3 way dimmer switch works with Amazon Alexa and Google Assistant, so you can control your light using simple voice commands. Free hands by using dimmer light switch and enjoy the convenience moment.

【Scheduling & App Control】Create customized schedules to light up your house automatically and remotely control them from anywhere anytime. Set your porch light to turn on 30 minutes after sunset and turn off 25 minutes before sunrise.

customers_say: Customers find the smart switch easy to install and appreciate its compatibility with both Alexa and Google Home systems. Moreover, the product receives positive feedback for its quality. However, the functionality and value for money receive mixed reviews - while some say it works great with Alexa and consider it a great inexpensive option, others report it stopped working within two months and describe it as cheaply made.AI Generated from the text of customer reviews

customer_reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on May 13, 2025
customer_reviews.review_snippet: I have been using Kasa for many years, but the switch on my kitchen lights would stop working after a few months. No matter how many times I replaced it. So I decided to try a different brand, and have not had an issue since changing it. I did contact Kasa and they tried blaming my wiring. Even though it's another app, but both are controlled by Alexa so no real inconvenience.

customer_reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on March 23, 2025
customer_reviews.review_snippet: Not sure why this is a frequently returned item. I was able to install it with no problem. As soon as I turned power back on and searched a new device in the smart life app, it found it. Works great. Only wish 4 little wires were included instead of having to strip off wires from the wall side.

customer_reviews.review_title: 5.0 out of 5 starsWorks well; Great customer support
customer_reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on January 10, 2025
customer_reviews.review_snippet: I initially had some trouble with the S/W setup.  The physical installation is easy once you find the line side switch.  I did have one switch die prematurely.  I had some trouble setting up the 2nd switch.  They replaced both switches.  The setup problem turned out to be me trying to use on a light with 4 switches.  This requires 4way switches and this device doesn't work properly if there are 4way switches in the circuit.  So it was really user error.  They worked closely with me to figure this out and they were prompt and polite in our debug conversation.  When installed with a light with 2 switches, the only configuration they support, the switch setup and operates smoothly and easily.

customer_reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on March 18, 2025
customer_reviews.review_snippet: For years I have been a Leviton guy and to some degree I still am. But Leviton are expensive so I tried some Kasa and this Gosund. It replaces a 3 way smart dimmer Leviton that could not be controlled from the companiok switch any longer after 6 years. I like about the GS that it works just fine in a 3 way config. Also it has a leg up to my Leviton which caused Leds to flicker until they were warm. This doesn't. The app is a little simplistic but good enough. Best app to me is Kasa with a very very close Leviton second. Anyway here is what's not so great about this GS switch. It's cheap and it looks cheap. The dimmer indicators also look much cheaper than pictured. It also feels cheap. It's some matte porous plastic That you need to insert the terminal screws yourself is also cheap. But for the price I am quite happy so far. I have it only for 2 days. The switch and regular three way is $25 whereas the Leviton set it replaces is more like $65. This GS uses 2 regular travelers. The Leviton can get away with 1. Overall I am happy.

customer_reviews.review_title: 1.0 out of 5 starsUnreliable and Frustrating – Stay Away from GHome Dimmers
customer_reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on May 15, 2025
customer_reviews.review_snippet: If I could give these dimmer switches zero stars, I would. I’ve gone through four of the GHome 3-way smart dimmer switches, and every single one failed within 1 to 4 months. On top of that, I also installed a 4-pack of their single pole dimmers in another room—and had the same exact issue. It's incredibly frustrating.What’s even more confusing is that the regular GHome smart switches I’ve had throughout my home for years work perfectly. The problem seems to be just with the dimmers. I’d switch to another brand, but then all my switches wouldn’t match. To make matters worse, I’m out of the return window, so I’m stuck with a bunch of broken switches. Just awful. Do yourself a favor and stay away from these.

customer_reviews.review_title: 5.0 out of 5 starsThe easiest install if your using Alexa
customer_reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on March 21, 2025
customer_reviews.review_snippet: This is the easiest smart switch I've ever installed. Next time I need a smart switch this is the one I'm purchasing. I barely had it hooked up and Alexa already had it loaded.

customer_reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on February 23, 2025
customer_reviews.review_snippet: Love these switches. Great product at a good price. I have replaced 15 switches in my home with the Gosund switches. Easy to wire and program. They work great with the Alexa app and setting up the routines is pretty simple.

customer_reviews.review_title: 3.0 out of 5 starsbe aware you might be on your own when trouble shooting
customer_reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on March 5, 2025
customer_reviews.review_snippet: I installed the switch where another brand had been installed and had failed after 6 years of service.  When I installed this switch and flipped the breaker on the light came on and the breaker tripped after approximately 3 seconds.  After several attempt of switching the traveler wire back and forth I gave up and put a dumb 3 way switch back to original wiring.  I took the gosund switch to another 3 way switch which had a working and installed with no problem.I called customer service at gosund and explained the problem and the only thing I could think of was the neutral wire I was using was from another circuit in the same 3 gang  box (two of the light in that box are on another circuit).  The customer service guy I was talking with ask me to send a picture showing the way I wired it and the box to which I said no I wasn't going to reinstall the switch and pull all those wire out when I all needed was a simple answer to my question about the neutral wire.  He asked for my email address and said he already had my phone number.  To date I have received no answer which is over a week.  I would like to buy another switch but won't unless I know it has a chance of working.  So inconclusion the switch works great but customer service is not the best.
